resources.string: Placeholder for generated codes to break

You are a Code Breaker. The goal is to crack the code consisting of a series of 4 colored pegs. 
 
 Every time you guess, you get feedback that narrows down what the code is. 
 
 Break the code in 10 guesses or less to win!
There are six colored pegs in your toolkit
Scroll down to row 1 to start, then touch a peg and select a spot to put it (active spots are highlighted)
A green checkmark appears once you fill in all four spots
Tap the checkmark to submit your code. Each time you submit, your code is compared to the game\'s code and feedback is provided.

The feedback appears on the left. RED indicates that one part of your code is the correct color and in the right place. WHITE indicates that one part of your code is the correct color but in the wrong place. Any slots without a RED or WHITE peg indicates that the color is not a part of the code. \n \n THERE IS NO ORDER TO THE FEEDBACK INDICATORS. There can also be duplicates, so don\'t count anything out too quickly!

Once you break the code all four indicators will be RED. \n \n Don\'t worry if you don\'t get it in 10 tries, the code will appear at the top. You\'ll get the hang of it and become a Master Code Breaker! Tap the Start button when you feel comfortable with this task
